content.prompt:
The Metropolitan Museum of Art

The work shown can be attributed to the Yoruba sculptor Olowe of Ise because of its

choices.label: strict frontality, small facial features, and deity shown on horseback
naturalistic proportions, rare and expensive materials, and glossy finish
elongated forms, dynamic use of negative space, and architectural function
symmetry, unpainted surface, and superiority of male over female figures

topic.text: 6.2: Purpose and Audience in African Art

skill.text: Skill 6.B: Justify an attribution of a work of art by explaining similarities with work by a specific artist, culture, art historical style, or object type from the image set.
